title: Using Data Moves to Make Sense of Height Estimates
text:
At an activity posted at estimation180.com, students are asked to estimate the height of the man in this picture:

In considering the height, students are asked to give

a lower limit (what would be a lower bound for the man’s height)
upper limit (what would be an upper bound for the man’s height)
a specific estimate for the height
provide a rationale for their estimate




library(conflicted)
library(skimr)
library(psych)
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     

library(janitor)
library(knitr)

conflicts_prefer(dplyr::lag)

[conflicted] Will prefer dplyr::lag over any other package.

conflicts_prefer(dplyr::filter)

[conflicted] Will prefer dplyr::filter over any other package.

options(scipen = 999, digits = 2)





height_est <- read_csv("Day 01 Height Estimates from Fergussen.csv")

Rows: 39195 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (6): Timestamp, What's too LOW?, What's too HIGH?, Your estimate., Your ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



glimpse(height_est)

Rows: 39,195
Columns: 6
$ Timestamp          <chr> "6/27/2014 13:36:55", "6/29/2014 11:49:03", "6/29/2…
$ `What's too LOW?`  <chr> "4", "2\"", "5 feet", "3 feet", "72 in", "1 Ft", "1…
$ `What's too HIGH?` <chr> "7", "10'", "7 feet", "8 feet", "90 in", "10 Ft", "…
$ `Your estimate.`   <chr> "5 ft 10in", "6\"2\"", "6' 4\"", "6 feet", "80 in",…
$ `Your reasoning.`  <chr> "The fence is probably 3 ft", "I used the railing a…
$ `Your name.`       <chr> "Sam", "Scott", "Derek", "Bob", "k", "I", "Strohl",…



height_est <- height_est |>
  mutate(Timestamp = mdy_hms(Timestamp))

title: Using Data Moves to Make Sense of Height Estimates
text:
library(conflicted)
library(skimr)
library(psych)
library(tidyverse)

title: Using Data Moves to Make Sense of Height Estimates
text:
height_est <- read_csv("Day 01 Height Estimates from Fergussen.csv")

Rows: 39195 Columns: 6
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (6): Timestamp, What's too LOW?, What's too HIGH?, Your estimate., Your ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



glimpse(height_est)

Rows: 39,195
Columns: 6
$ Timestamp          <chr> "6/27/2014 13:36:55", "6/29/2014 11:49:03", "6/29/2…
$ `What's too LOW?`  <chr> "4", "2\"", "5 feet", "3 feet", "72 in", "1 Ft", "1…
$ `What's too HIGH?` <chr> "7", "10'", "7 feet", "8 feet", "90 in", "10 Ft", "…
$ `Your estimate.`   <chr> "5 ft 10in", "6\"2\"", "6' 4\"", "6 feet", "80 in",…
$ `Your reasoning.`  <chr> "The fence is probably 3 ft", "I used the railing a…
$ `Your name.`       <chr> "Sam", "Scott", "Derek", "Bob", "k", "I", "Strohl",…



height_est <- height_est |>
  mutate(Timestamp = mdy_hms(Timestamp))
